sage.input.action

Class AbstractInputAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.input.action.AbstractInputAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LookDownAction, LookLeftAction, LookRightAction, LookUpAction, MouseLookAction, MoveBackwardAction, MoveDownAction, MoveForwardAction, MoveLeftAction, MoveRightAction, MoveUpAction, QuitGameAction, ResetCameraAction, RollLeftAction, RollRightAction, RunAction

    public abstract class AbstractInputAction
extends java.lang.Object
implements IAction
    AbstractInputAction is the base class from which all SAGE input actions are derived. It maintains a speed associated with the action, and specifies a method performAction() which must be implemented by all concrete subclasses.
    Author:
    John Clevenger; based on a development version by Russell Bolles
    See Also:
    IAction, InputManager.associateAction(net.java.games.input.Component.Identifier, IAction, sage.input.IInputManager.INPUT_ACTION_TYPE)

      • AbstractInputAction

        public AbstractInputAction()

    • Method Detail

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(float newSpeed)
        Sets the speed at which the Action occurs (default = 1). The interpretation of speed units is application (game) dependent.

      • getSpeed

        public float getSpeed()
        Returns the current speed setting for the Action

      • performAction

        public abstract void performAction(float time,
                                   net.java.games.input.Event evt)
        performAction() is invoked to execute this input action. It must be implemented by all concrete subclasses.
        Specified by:
        performAction in interface IAction
        Parameters:
        time - -- the time at which the action is invoked
        evt - -- the event associated with invoking this action
